summary: In this calculation you initially deposited {initialDeposit} into your savings account. Each month you contributed {monthlyContribution}. If the annual return were {annualReturnPercent}, after {years} years you would have a total of {totalBalance} in your savings account. Of this, {totalContributions} would be your deposits and {totalGain} the profit.

deposits.title: Deposits
deposits.description: Amount you contribute in each year in addition to your initial capital.

interest.title: Interest
interest.description: Return based on your savings balance accrued each year.

balance.title: Balance
balance.description: Total wealth at the end of the year, consisting of initial capital, deposits, and accumulated gains.

info.startCapital: The amount of money available at the beginning and used for initial expenses.
info.monthlyContribution: A fixed amount added every month in addition to the initial capital to co-finance the plan.
info.expectedAnnualReturn: Estimated yearly percentage gain that your deposits may earn (e.g., via interest or appreciation).
info.durationYears: Time span in years over which the initial capital and monthly deposits are invested or calculated.
